title: ICE: attempt to subtract with overflow, compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:348:47

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code Rebase bdb5a5ffe17 over ac8dd1b2f24dc62c962172b27433106b4e84dc62, then run `x test src/tools/clippy`. I think this is the `write_literal_2` test. cc @rust-lang/clippy, but I think this is an issue with rustc_errors, not clippy itself. ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` note: Clippy version: clippy 0.1.57 (ac8dd1b2f24 2021-09-26) ``` ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'attempt to subtract with overflow', compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:348:47 ```
Backtrace
